result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert H Redford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 6 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or the read-in list.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
FIRST 60 DAYS:  to be served through Huber Facility with the FOLLOWING 60 DAYS to be served through the Day Report Program.
LAST 4 MONTHS are stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion.
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 07:00 p.m. on 08-28-2016.

6 days credit if revoked.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

TERM OF PROBATION:  30 MONTHS;
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by agent;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with victims listed in complaint or read-in list.
*DNA sample to be provided.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Apply bail.  Balance to be refunded to the posting party.  

CONDITION TIME: 
8 months in the Waukesha County Jail with Huber (all standard release conditions).  
First 60 days to be served through the Huber facility.  Second 60 days to be served through the Day Report Program.  
Last 4 months stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.
